intro: Hieracium tucumanicum, commonly known as Tucumán hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a low-growing habit with basal leaves. Its flowers are yellow or orange, arranged in a composite structure, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium tucumanicum is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
